intro: Bupleurum falcatum f. elongatum, commonly known as the long-leaved bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological habitats.
